origin.a: I was born in a big fart.
origin.b: I'm from the land of errant wind.
origin.c: I am the child of the air and the earth.

goal.a: When I was younger I fell in love with my own reflection.
goal.b: As a child, I never liked any one else
goal.c: I was always lonely because no one was good enough for me.

obstacle.a: I could make any one fall in love with me but I couldn't fall in love with anyone else.
obstacle.b: I've had a chance with every creature I've met but none has had a chance with me.
obstacle.c: I've never known another creature like I know myself.

reward.a: I have been told there is a portal to another land, a mirror world, where I could find myself.
reward.b: There is a legend of an world below the surface of idtio, like like the veins under our skin.
reward.c: In the bowels of the land of idtio is where I know I'll find love.

origin.a: I came from an ocean of peepee.
origin.b: As an infant I drank in the yellow waters of South Idtio.
origin.c: I come from the acidic land of South Idtio.

goal.a: I'm an idiot who only values beauty.
goal.b: I think the cat is the most beautiful creature in this land but she told the television she doesn't like me.
goal.c: I have been with the most beautiful creatures in the land.

obstacle.a: Is it obvious that I hate myself?
obstacle.b: No one ever seems to remember who I am.

reward.a: If the cat is desperate enough we may be together.
reward.b: I hope to find the creature for me, I just need to know where to look.
reward.c: I won't let go of a creature until I find a new one.

origin.a: I grew up in the dense forest in the east.
origin.b: I'm from the east, where the trees begin and the land ends.
origin.c: When I was younger I lived in the forest and I kind of wish I had never left.

goal.a: I fell in love with the most intelligent but dirty creature.
goal.b: I was always distracted by love.
goal.c: I wanted to build a nest somewhere.

obstacle.a: I don't know if a creature can truly feel love.
obstacle.b: I don't know if two creatures can really know each other.
obstacle.c: I think there's someone else but I don't understand their connection.

reward.a: I want to be the one to discover the void and show my creature the way inside.
reward.b: I don't want to be alone here if they're together.
reward.c: What if I was the only one to find the void?

origin.a: I was born in the south under the shadow of a tropical tree.
origin.b: I'm from the curve in land where the young become old.
origin.c: I grew up in the fragrant south where I never aged.

goal.a: Honestly, I just want to find somewhere that's not lame.
goal.b: I don't care where you're from.
goal.c: I'm so sick of these conversations.

obstacle.b: Screw looking for the void or whatever.
obstacle.c: Sorry I wasn't responding to your waves before, it's been such a long day.

reward.a: I'm not gonna go in that void, I don't really care.
reward.c: I have to go but I'll definitely see you later.

origin.b: I could have come from anywhere, I emerged from dirt and was immediately blinded by the power of the sun.
origin.c: I'll never go back into the mud where I was born.

goal.a: One day I'll be the most famous worm that ever lived, once I discover the connection between the void and our world.
goal.b: I'll be more than just a worm.
goal.c: I know the secret of the void and I know the fruit will follow me to it.

obstacle.a: I miss the fish but we weren't right for each other.  Too many secrets.
obstacle.b: The bug is beautiful, I will always remember what we had.
obstacle.c: I think the fruit like me.

reward.a: I know what's needed to bring to the void.
reward.b: There's a skull submerged in dirt that contained the directions to the void.
reward.c: I will bring the fruit to the void.

origin.a: I lived in the house before it was burned down.  They left me inside.
origin.b: I never really left the house.  I didn't know what was going on when everyone would disappear.
origin.c: I'm from the burnt down house in the south west.

goal.a: I wasn't ready for everyone to leave.
goal.b: I want them to come back.
goal.c: I want to be with my family and friends.

obstacle.a: Everyone is looking for some secret place instead of looking for me.
obstacle.b: I don't really care about finding anything else in the world.
obstacle.c: Why can't people just be happy and hang out?

reward.a: Don't go looking for anything, just sit here with me.
reward.b: Let's go back to the house and just hang out in the ruins.

origin.a: I'm from the deserted lands past the two hills.
origin.c: I'm from the desert where the sun makes everything bright and dry.

goal.a: After spending days and days outside I began to write poems.
goal.b: I will sing a song about the darkest region in this land.
goal.c: You may have heard of the bard of the west.  That's me.  I am him.

obstacle.a: I've been distracted from my quest by my own charisma.
obstacle.b: I'm such a good poet that I'm always busy reciting my poems for all the idiots of this world.
obstacle.c: I never have time to search for my true muse.

reward.a: There is a darkness that will inspire my truest poem.
reward.b: In darkness I will my find my true voice.
reward.c: Help me find the entrance to the dark side of this world.

origin.a: I was born in the North Sea.
origin.b: I never really wanted to leave the sea.
origin.c: As a child I was starved for attention.

goal.a: Did the worm find the void?  I don't want the worm to get there before me.
goal.b: What about the television?  Where's the television?
goal.c: Ugh I don't want to talk to the cat.

obstacle.a: Nothing ever works out for me.
obstacle.b: Honestly, I care too much about everyone's stupid crap.
obstacle.c: I should have gone back to the sea a long time ago.

reward.a: I don't even care about the void.
reward.b: I'm too scared to ask for what I want.
reward.c: I really just want someone to come to the sea with me.

origin.a: I actually was born in the void.
origin.b: I don't know how I got here.
origin.c: I was just looking for something to eat.

goal.a: Are there any other bugs here?
goal.b: I'd like to make amends with the worm.  But don't tell the worm that.
goal.c: If everyone wants to find the void I can tell them where to look.

obstacle.a: I've just been hanging out with the fish all day but they want to go into the water.
obstacle.b: Oh yeah I'm close with the cat too.
obstacle.c: I can't really walk that fast.

reward.a: I guess I'm on the fense.  I'd like to stay here but the void is cool too.
reward.b: If everyone goes to the void I'll go.
reward.c: If you want to stay here that would be fine too.
